thread.title: Steep Canyon Rangers to play Payomet
thread.title_full: Steep Canyon Rangers to play Payomet

title: Steep Canyon Rangers to play Payomet
text: Steep Canyon Rangers to play Payomet Just a few weeks after releasing the album “Radio,” the Grammy Award-winning Steep Canyon Rangers will make their first appearance Saturday at the Eastham Elks Lodge in North Eastham. Comment Posted Oct. 8, 2015 at 2:01 AM Posted Oct. 8, 2015 at 2:01 AM » Social News Just a few weeks after releasing the album “Radio,” the Grammy Award-winning Steep Canyon Rangers on Saturday will make their first appearance for Payomet Performing Arts Center, which will host the concert at the Eastham Elks Lodge. The Asheville, North Carolina-based sextet plays acoustic bluegrass music rooted in tradition, and is also known for frequently collaborating with comedian/banjo player Steve Martin and Edie Brickell. The group has produced nine albums in its 15 years together, according to its website, and won the 2013 best bluegrass album Grammy for “Nobody Knows You.” The Payomet concert starts at 7:30 p.m. at the lodge at One McKoy Road, North Eastham. Tickets are $23 to $48. Reservations and information: 508-487-5400, 508-349-2929 or www.payomet.org . capecodtimes.com
